title.value: Influence of preprocessing, distortion correction and cardiac triggering on the quality of diffusion MR images of spinal cord
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the top of the document and is specific to the focus of the research.
title.quote: Influence of preprocessing, distortion correction and cardiac triggering on the quality of diffusion MR images of spinal cord

extractions.description: This research paper evaluates the impact of preprocessing, distortion correction, and cardiac triggering on the quality of diffusion MR images of the spinal cord. The study involves a variety of datasets and applies multiple preprocessing algorithms to analyze their effects.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments using data and evaluates the outcomes of different preprocessing algorithms and conditions on the quality of diffusion MR images.
type.quote: To do this, we designed experiments to directly test differences with and without triggering, and assess image quality, image artifacts, and changes in quantitative parameters and reproducibility.

name.justification: The paper deals with diffusion MR images of the spinal cord, which is a key area in medical imaging.
name.quote: Diffusion magnetic resonance imaging (dMRI) is a medical imaging technique that provides information on the microstructure and anatomic connectivity of the spinal cord (SC).

name.justification: The paper specifically discusses diffusion MRI techniques and their applications to spinal cord imaging.
name.quote: Diffusion magnetic resonance imaging (dMRI) is a medical imaging technique that provides information on the microstructure and anatomic connectivity of the spinal cord (SC).

name.justification: The research focuses on imaging the spinal cord using various MRI techniques.
name.quote: This study investigates two strategies to address dMRI artifacts: susceptibility correction to mitigate geometric distortions with image processing, and cardiac triggering to mitigate motion artifacts during image acquisition.

name.justification: The paper describes a dataset referred to as 'Cervical HC' focusing on healthy control cervical spinal cord imaging.
name.quote: Cervical HC (N=55 total datasets, 42 subjects, 13 with two visits; mean age ± standard deviation = 31.6 ± 7.1 years)

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper title is provided for this dataset within the document.

name.justification: The paper includes a dataset named 'Cervical MS' for multiple sclerosis cervical spinal cord imaging.
name.quote: Cervical MS (N=54 total datasets, 40 subjects, 14 with two visits; mean age ± standard deviation = 34.7 ± 6.5 years)

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper title is provided for this dataset within the document.

name.justification: A dataset referred to as 'Cervical #2 HC' is mentioned, focusing on a study cohort with cervical spinal cord imaging.
name.quote: Cervical #2 included HC for a project investigating stenosis of the cord

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper title is provided for this dataset within the document.

name.justification: A dataset named 'Cervical AP' which involves anterior-posterior phase encoding direction for cervical spinal cord imaging.
name.quote: Cervical AP and Cervical RL images were acquired to investigate effects specifically of phase encode direction (and consequently distortion direction)

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper title is provided for this dataset within the document.

name.justification: The paper mentions a dataset 'Cervical RL' which uses right-left phase encoding direction for cervical spinal cord imaging.
name.quote: Cervical AP and Cervical RL images were acquired to investigate effects specifically of phase encode direction (and consequently distortion direction)

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper title is provided for this dataset within the document.

name.justification: A dataset called 'Lumbar HC' focusing on lumbar spinal cord imaging in healthy controls.
name.quote: Lumbar datasets a dual channel body coil (transmission) and a 12-channel in-couch SC array (receive) were used.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper title is provided for this dataset within the document.

name.justification: A dataset named 'Lumbar MS' focusing on lumbar spinal cord imaging in subjects with multiple sclerosis.
name.quote: Lumbar MS datasets were acquired as part of a project to optimize protocols in the lumbar cord

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper title is provided for this dataset within the document.
